body: Welcome to the Guadalupes!  National parks can provide fascinating ways for students to learn about geology, animals, plants, and cultural history.    The Curriculum Materials section has lesson plans and activities with more materials being added soon.   The park offers guided Field Trips for students of all ages.     Please feel free to contact us at 915-828-3251 or by email.                  Seeing is Believing Make history and science come alive with a trip out to the park. Our various sites highlight significant and unique areas. Read More        Social Media Meet Ranger Stanley or ask a ranger a question!  Guadalupe Mountains National Park keeps visitors up to date with regular posts on its Facebook page. Read More        Stories from Stones The Guadalupe Mountains were built by an ancient reef system. These three lesson plans give an overview of that history. Read More
